sen.j: 平 知章（たいら の ともあきら、嘉応元年（1169年） - 寿永3年2月7日 (旧暦)（1184年3月20日））は、平知盛の長男。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tomoakira (1169 - March 20, 1184) was the oldest son of TAIRA no Tomomori.
TAIRA no Tomoakira (1169 - March 20, 1184) was the oldest son of TAIRA no Tomomori.
TAIRA no Tomoakira (1169 - March 20, 1184) was the oldest son of TAIRA no Tomomori.

sen.j: 母は八条院女房治部卿局。
sen.e: His mother was Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo for Hachijoin.
His mother was Jibukyo no tsubone, a court-lady serving Imperial Prince Hachijyoin Akiko.
sen.cmt: 八条院女房治部卿局の説明が不適当と思われます。
sen.e: His mother was Jibukyo no tsubone, a court-lady serving Imperial Prince Hachijyoin Akiko.

sen.j: 従五位上、左馬頭兼武蔵国守。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Samanokami (Captain of the Left Division of Samaryo) and Musashi no kuni no kami (Governor of Musashi Province).
His official court rank was Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Samanokami (Captain of Samaryo [Left Division of Bureau of Horses]) and Musashi no kuni no kami (Governor of Musashi Province).
sen.cmt: 左馬寮の説明が必要です。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Samanokami (Captain of Samaryo [Left Division of Bureau of Horses]) and Musashi no kuni no kami (Governor of Musashi Province).
He was known for Herculean strength.
He was renowned for his superhuman strength.
He was renowned for his superhuman strength.

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）の平家都落ちに伴って西海へ。
sen.e: In 1183, he went down to the Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast) after the flight of the Taira clan from Kyoto.
In 1183, leaving the capital along with the Taira clan, he took refuge in the Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast).
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1183, leaving the capital along with the Taira clan, he took refuge in the Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast).

sen.j: 寿永3年（1184年）2月の一ノ谷の戦いでは、父・知盛に従い、源氏方の源義経軍と戦闘。
sen.e: In February 1184, He followed his father Tomomori and fought against the MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune's army which took the side of the Genji in the Battle of Ichinotani.
In the Battle of Ichinotani broke out in February 1184, he fought against the troops belonging to the Minamoto clan that were commanded by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, with his father Tomomori.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: In the Battle of Ichinotani broke out in February 1184, he fought against the troops belonging to the Minamoto clan that were commanded by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, with his father Tomomori.

sen.j: 『平家物語』の「知章最期」によると、全軍総崩れの中、知盛と知章、郎党の監物頼方の主従三騎で敗走。
sen.e: According to the chapter titled 'Tomoakira no saigo' (The Death of Tomoakira) of "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike), he, Tomomori and their retainer Yorikata who served as kenmotsu (inspector of the transfer into and from warehouses of the Court) rode their horses and retreated amid the debacle of their entire army.

According to the chapter titled 'Tomoakira no saigo' (The End of Tomoakira) of "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike), Tomoakira, his father Tomomori and their retainer kenmotsu (inspector of the transfer into and from ware houses of the Court) Yorikata were put to flight on horseback amid the debacle of their whole army.
sen.cmt: "retreat"では敗走の意味と異なると思われ，書き換えました。「最期」をEndに替えました。
sen.e: According to the chapter titled 'Tomoakira no saigo' (The End of Tomoakira) of "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike), Tomoakira, his father Tomomori and their retainer kenmotsu (inspector of the transfer into and from ware houses of the Court) Yorikata were put to flight on horseback amid the debacle of their whole army.

sen.j: 海岸に出たところを、源氏方の児玉党に追い付かれ、交戦。
sen.e: When they reached the seashore, Kodama party of the Genji rode down and fought them.
Caught up by the Kodama party belonging to the Genji clan after reaching the seashore, they were forced to fight against the party.
sen.cmt: 訳文の主語がわかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Caught up by the Kodama party belonging to the Genji clan after reaching the seashore, they were forced to fight against the party.

sen.j: 児玉党の大将が知盛に組付くところに割って入り、児玉党の大将を討ち取った。
sen.e: Tomoakira blocked Taisho (a general) of Kodama party from pouncing upon Tomomori and killed the Taisho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Noticing that Tomomori was tackled by the head of Kodama party, he squeezed himself into the two and killed the head.
sen.cmt: 原文のイメージがわかないために書き換えました。
sen.e: Noticing that Tomomori was tackled by the head of Kodama party, he squeezed himself into the two and killed the head.

sen.j: しかし周囲の武士に討ち取られた。
sen.e: But then Tomoakira was surrounded and killed by samurai warriors of Kodama party.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Tomoakira was killed by samurai warriors around him.
sen.cmt: 原文と訳文の意味が異なります。
sen.e: However, Tomoakira was killed by samurai warriors around him.
